item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Connie Willis
item.description: "Why do only the awful things become fads? I thought. Eye-rolling and Barbie and bread pudding. Why never chocolate cheesecake or thinking for yourself?" -- Connie Willis

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Connie Willis
item.description: "Cats, as you know, are quite impervious to threats." -- Connie Willis

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "The only escape from the miseries of life are music and cats..." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If animals could speak, the dog would be a blundering outspoken fellow; but the cat would have the rare grace of never saying a word too much." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "I believe cats to be spirits come to earth. A cat, I am sure, could walk on a cloud without coming through." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Lilian Jackson Braun
item.description: "Cats are cats . . . the world over! These intelligent, peace-loving, four-footed friends- who are without prejudice, without hate, without greed- may someday teach us something. -James Mackintosh Qwilleran" -- Lilian Jackson Braun

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "Nothing is so firmly believed as that which we least know." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A cat's rage is beautiful, burning with pure cat flame, all its hair standing up and crackling blue sparks, eyes blazing and sputtering." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Mary Bly
item.description: "Dogs come when they're called; cats take a message and get back to you later." -- Mary Bly

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Hippolyte A. Taine
item.description: "I have studied many philosophers and many cats. The wisdom of cats is infinitely superior." -- Hippolyte A. Taine

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "I find I am much prouder of the victory I obtain over myself, when, in the very ardor of dispute, I make myself submit to my adversary’s force of reason, than I am pleased with the victory I obtain over him through his weakness." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Robert Byrne
item.description: "To err is human, to purr is feline." -- Robert Byrne

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Seanan McGuire
item.description: "When Rome burned, the emperor's cats still expected to be fed on time." -- Seanan McGuire

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "That's the great secret of creativity. You treat ideas like cats: you make them follow you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I love them, they are so nice and selfish. Dogs are TOO good and unselfish. They make me feel uncomfortable. But cats are gloriously human." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You love me. Real or not real?" I tell him, "Real." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Isabel Jazmín add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath
